algebraic.mle 0.9.0

    Exponential distribution MLE Normal distribution MLE Fitting models to unknown DGPs

Function reference

All functions

aic()
Generic method for obtaining the AIC of a fitted distribution object fit.
aic(<mle>)
Method for obtaining the AIC of an `mle` object.
algebraic.mle
`algebraic.mle`: A package for algebraically operating on and generating maximum likelihood estimators from existing maximum likelihood estimators.
bias()
Computes the bias of an estimator object.
bias(<mle>)
Computes the bias of an `mle` object assuming the large sample approximation is valid and the MLE regularity conditions are satisfied. In this case, the bias is zero (or zero vector).
bias(<mle_boot>)
Computes the estimate of the bias of a `mle_boot` object.
bias(<mle_exp_rate>)
Computes the bias of an `exp_mle` object (exponential mle).
bias(<mle_normal_mu_var>)
Computes the bias of an `mle_normal_mu_var` object.
chisqr.test()
chi-squar goodness-of-fit test
confint(<mle>)
Function to compute the confidence intervals of `mle` objects.
cramer.test()
Cramer Von Mises hypothesis test
exp_rate_fisher_info()
Fisher information function generator for the exponential distribution
exp_rate_loglike()
log-likelihood function generator given data `x` for the exponential distribution
exp_rate_score()
score (derivative of log-likelihood) function generator given data `x` for the exponential distribution
fim()
Generic method for obtaining the fisher information matrix of an `mle` object.
fim(<mle>)
Function for obtaining the fisher information matrix of an `mle` object.
fim(<mle_boot>)
Computes the variance-covariance matrix of `boot` object.
is_converged()
Function to determine whether an `mle` object has converged.
is_mle()
Determine if an object `x` is an `mle` object.
loglike()
Generic method for obtaining the log-likelihood of fitted distribution object, assuming it has a likelihood function, e.g., a fitted `mle` object.
loglike(<mle>)
Method for obtaining the log-likelihood of an `mle` object.
mle()
`mle` makes an `mle` object.
mle_boot()
Bootstrap MLE
mle_exp_rate()
MLE of the rate parameter when we assume the sample is i.i.d. and drawn from the exponential distribution.
mle_gradient_ascent()
mle_gradient_ascent
mle_local_search()
mle_local_search
mle_newton_raphson()
MLE method using the Newton-Raphson method
mle_normal_mu_var()
MLE of the (mu,var) parameter vector when we assume the sample is i.i.d. and drawn from the normal distribution.
mle_optim()
mle_optim
mle_weibull_shape_scale()
MLE of the rate parameter when we assume the sample is i.i.d. and drawn from the weibull distribution.
mle_weighted()
Accepts a list of `mle` objects for some parameter, say `theta`, and combines them into a single estimator `mle_weighted`.
mse()
Generic function for obtaining the mean squared error (MSE) of an estimator, `mse(x) = E[(x-mu)^2]` where `mu` is the true parameter value.
mse(<mle>)
Computes the MSE of an `mle` object.
mse(<mle_boot>)
Computes the estimate of the MSE of a `boot` object.
nobs(<mle>)
Method for obtaining the number of observations in the sample used by an `mle`.
nobs(<mle_boot>)
Method for obtaining the number of observations in the sample used by an `mle`.
normal_fisher_info_mu_var()
Fisher information matrix generator given data `x` for the normal distribution
normal_loglike_mu_var()
log-likelihood function generator given data `x` for the normal distribution
normal_score_mu_var()
Score function generator given data `x` for the normal distribution
nparams()
Generic method for obtaining the number of parameters of a fitted distribution object.
nparams(<mle>)
Method for obtaining the number of parameters of an `mle` object.
nparams(<mle_boot>)
Method for obtaining the number of parameters of an `boot` object.
obs()
Generic function for obtaining the observations used by a fitted model `object`.
obs(<mle>)
Method for obtaining the observations used by the `mle`.
obs(<mle_boot>)
Method for obtaining the observations used by the `mle`.
orthogonal()
Method for determining the orthogonal parameters of an estimator.
orthogonal(<mle>)
Method for determining the orthogonal components of an `mle` object `x`.
params()
Method for obtaining the parameters of a fitted distribution object.
params(<mle>)
Method for obtaining the parameters of an `mle` object.
params(<mle_boot>)
Method for obtaining the parameters of an `boot` object.
point()
Generic method for obtaining the best point estimate from an estimator.
point(<mle>)
Computes the point estimate of an `mle` object.
point(<mle_boot>)
Computes the point estimate of an `mle` object.
pred()
Compute the predictive confidence interval given an estimator object `x`.
pred(<mle>)
Estimate of predictive interval of `T|x` where `T` is a statistic and `x` is an `mle` object that it is conditioned on. Generally, what this means is that we want to find the distribution of `T` when we marginalize over the distribution of `x`, since `x` is an uncertain estimate of the true parameter value.
print(<mle>)
Method for obtaining the number of observations in the sample used by an `mle` object `x`.
print(<summary_mle>)
Function for printing a `summary` object for an `mle` object.
rmap()
Generic function for computing the distribution of `f(x)` where `x` models a distribution (random element) object.
rmap(<mle>)
rmap.mle
sample_mle_region()
Function for obtaining sample points for an `mle` object that is within the `p`-probability region.
sampler()
Generic function for sampling from distribution objects.
sampler(<mle>)
Method for sampling from an `mle` object.
sampler(<mle_boot>)
Method for sampling from an `mle_boot` object.
score()
score
score(<mle>)
score
se()
Method for obtaining the standard error of an estimator.
se(<mle>)
Function for obtaining an estimate of the standard error of the MLE `object`.
se(<mle_boot>)
Function for obtaining an estimate of the standard error of the bootstrap of the MLE `object`.
sim_anneal()
sim_anneal
summary(<mle>)
Function for obtaining a summary of `object`, which is a fitted `mle` object.
two.sample.test()
General two sample hypothesis test.
vcov(<mle>)
Computes the variance-covariance matrix of `mle` objects.
vcov(<mle_boot>)
Computes the variance-covariance matrix of `boot` object.
weibull_shape_scale_fim()
log-likelihood function generator given data `x` for the weibull distribution
weibull_shape_scale_loglike()
log-likelihood function generator given data `x` for the weibull distribution.
weibull_shape_scale_score()
score function generator given data `x` for the weibull distribution given a simple random sample.
